questions.prompt: What is the word, taken from Greek, that can be defined in a geometric sense as a polyhedron formed by connecting the corners of any polygon (regular or otherwise) to a single point on a different plane (that is, to its "apex")?

Identify the fruit, a hybrid between a mandarin and a sweet orange, that is named after a French missionary (last name Rodier) in whose Northern Algerian garden the hybrid originated in the late 19th century.
Kinder- und Hausmärchen was published in two volumes from 1812 to 1815 as a collection of works assembled by whom?

What is the two-word Latin term of art that essentially conveys the message "don't forget, you're going to die" and refers to symbols of mortality (e.g., a skull, flowers, candle, hourglass) that are especially prevalent in still lifes?

The Mini was famously designed by Sir Alec Issigonis in 1959, and Harley Earl was the father of the Corvette. To what German automotive icon (and automotive namesake in his own right) has the design of Volkswagen Beetle in 1937 been credited?
Zürich, Bern, Luzern, Schaffhausen, Appenzell Innerrhoden, and Neuchâtel are among the 26 federated states of Switzerland known as what?
